TopicTitle: Help me decide on some games?

Articles.Content:
OK, so. I've bought parts for my new computer, and the processor happens to be an FX 8350 and the graphics card happens too be an r7 370. This was all by accident. But it doesn't matter, cause I like them. So, AMD is offering free games to people who buy computers with their stuff in it between I don't know and December 2016 I think. 

The same applies if you buy their parts in the time.

Now, there are three games which I can't decide from.

Battlefield Hardline

Battlefield 4

And the new Need for Speed game.

Help decide?
None of those fit within my preferred game genre... so you don't want my advice.
I'm not a huge fan of racing games, so I'd probably go for one of the Battlefield games.
Battlefield 4, but you should probably save for Battlefield 1.

If I had to choose between those three I would most definitely say Battlefield 4, not sure what it's like in other countries but a lot of people still play it here. I know people who went through the regret of buying Hardline and the only racing game I would recommend buying is Burnout Paradise...
The most expensive one
Battlefield 4. From what I have heard and seen, hardline is just a low effort reskin of 4. And I wouldn't touch a new need for speed game with a 100 meter pole while wearing a hazmat suit.

Of the ones listed, Battlefield 4 is the best.  As others have said, Hardline is a disappointing re-skin of BF 4.

Need for Speed might be good if you have a racing wheel, but otherwise not worth the time.
